cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi ESE of Grand Turk Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest, expected to pass near the Turks & Caicos and Bahamas, then curve northwest toward the Florida Peninsula and inland across the Southeast U.S.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Matanzas, Cuba eastward to Guantanamo; Northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Puerto Rico, northern Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, Turks & Caicos, southeastern and central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida coast, Georgia coast, and portions of the Carolinas likely to experience hazardous conditions
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (with a chance of hurricane-force gusts) are possible as the core passes inland to the west of Jacksonville.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge of 3–6 ft along the northeast Florida coast and up the St. Johns River near Jacksonville.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 6–10 inches possible, leading to significant river and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Fresh-water flooding along the St. Johns River and its tributaries and isolated tornadoes in rainbands.
